annotations.description: We were witnesses to a rather ordinary game without many stirring moments. There is definitely room for improvement in future games. A very even game was seen on the pitch today. The hosts displayed good teamplay with a lot of passes. The visiting side patiently waited in their own half to dispossess the opponent and hit them on the break.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Johannes Geis (Schalke) steps up to take the corner. He launches the ball into the penalty area, but it only finds the head of an opposing player who clears the danger.
The ball is cleared after Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) attempted to dribble past an opposing player. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Schalke.

annotations.label: time
annotations.description: There will be a minimum of 2 min. of added time.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Leon Goretzka (Schalke).

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Nabil Bentaleb is replaced by Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke).
Sebastian Rode (Dortmund) delivers a lovely cross into the penalty area. Nevertheless, an opposition defender is alert and averts the danger with a brilliant clearance.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Substitution. Ousmane Dembele did his best and is replaced by Sebastian Rode (Dortmund).
Raphael Guerreiro almost gets into in a promising position, but the through ball by Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) from just inside the box is intercepted by one of the defending players.
Pierre Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) gives away a foul during an attacking move and the referee blows his whistle.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) makes a slide tackle, but referee Felix Brych blows for a foul.
Pierre Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Andre Schurrle (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch for Shinji Kagawa.
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) whips the ball into the penalty area, but one of the defenders is alert and spanks it away.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Mario Gotze (Dortmund) decides to take a short corner instead of crossing into the box.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Here comes a substitution. Max Meyer is given a rest as he is replaced by Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).

Pierre Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) produces an inaccurate low pass into the box that is blocked by the one of the defenders. If this pass had slipped through, the ball would have probably ended up in the back of the net. The ball goes behind for a corner. Dortmund will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Ralf Fahrmann was forced into action to thwart Mario Gotze (Dortmund). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Felix Passlack.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) is penalised for a foul. Felix Brych had a clear view and blows his whistle.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Johannes Geis (Schalke) goes over to take the corner kick and it looks like he will swing the ball into the penalty box.

Maxim Choupo Moting (Schalke) crosses into the box from near the side line, but he doesn't connect as he wanted and it's cleared by the well organized defence. The referee blows his whistle, Schalke are awarded a corner kick.
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) whips the ball in from the long range free kick, but the first man gets it clear.
Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) sends a teasing cross into the area, but Ralf Fahrmann intercepts the ball.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Sokratis (Dortmund) for his blatant foul.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: That will be all from Franco Di Santo who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Maxim Choupo Moting (Schalke).

annotations.label: attendance
annotations.description: The attendance for today's match is 80179.
The flag goes up and the referee blows his whistle another offside by Franco Di Santo (Schalke), who has already been caught several times today.
Pierre Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) attempted to curl the ball over the defensive wall from the free kick, but with no success.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) tackles a bit over zealously and Felix Brych blows for a foul. Dortmund have a free kick.
A pass from Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) is intercepted by Roman Burki and the move breaks down.
Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) latches onto a brilliant cross and fires the ball towards goal, but his shot goes high over the crossbar.
Felix Passlack (Dortmund) plays a dangerous chip pass into the box in an attempt to set up one of his teammates, but the effort is intercepted by one of the defenders.
The keeper doesn't have to worry about this one. Felix Passlack (Dortmund) sacrificed accuracy for power, and thus his attempt went well over the bar.
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) controls a cross deep inside the box and hits the crossbar!

Long passes, short passes and one two passes. Dortmund are showcasing great team work by keeping possession and producing pin point passes from player to player. The opposition's players are finding it very difficult to intercept at the moment.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Johannes Geis (Schalke) takes the corner, but he overhits it and none of his teammates are able to reach the ball.

Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Roman Burki pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. Schalke force a corner. They send men into the box.
A cross from Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) fails to reach the box as the defence clears the ball away to safety.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The corner kick from Johannes Geis (Schalke) is headed out of the penalty area by one of the defenders.
Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) delivers a fine lofted cross into the penalty area, but it's cleared by an opposing player. The linesman makes the right call and Schalke will have a corner.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The whistle blows and Felix Brych starts the second half.

The fans have so far witnessed an unattractive game, with barely any exciting moments to stir interest. Even first half from both sides, and they've both had chances. The home side attempts to hold onto the ball for as long as possible, while the away team's main weapon is fast counter attacks.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.

Mario Gotze (Dortmund) sends a lofted cross into the penalty area. Unfortunately for him, the opponent's defence deals with his cross comfortably and intercepts it. The ball is out of play. Dortmund will take a throw in.
Pierre Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is flagged offside and it's not the first time today.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) sends the ball into the penalty area from a throw in as if it's a corner kick.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: The yellow card is received by Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund).
Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) is caught offside after the linesman raises his flag.
Naldo (Schalke) clearly holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows his whistle for a foul.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Tempers flare after Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.
Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) makes an unfair challenge by holding his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Matija Nastasic (Schalke) has tested the patience of referee Felix Brych and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Franco Di Santo (Schalke) tries to create a chance, but puts too much weight on his pass. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Dortmund.
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) dinks a cross into the box in an attempt to find one of his teammates, but the defence manages to clear.
The linesman signals that Franco Di Santo (Schalke) is offside and the referee confirms the decision.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) produces a lovely ball into the penalty area but the defender manages to intercept and comfortably averts the danger.
Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) tries to find Sead Kolasinac, but he puts too much power on the through ball. The ball goes out of play and Dortmund will have a goal kick.

Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) attempts to find the head of one of his teammates with a promising cross into the box, but a defender outjumps the attackers and averts the threat. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.

Leon Goretzka (Schalke) produces a long range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads towards the middle of the goal, but is easily stopped by a save from Roman Burki and the score remains the same.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) quickly takes the free kick with a short pass.

Felix Brych blows his whistle as Max Meyer (Schalke) used excessive force in the tackle during an attack. It's a free kick to Dortmund, but they probably won't attempt a direct shot on goal from here.
Julian Weigl (Dortmund) gives away a foul for a clumsy challenge. Referee Felix Brych saw the whole situation.
Dortmund are dominating the game at the moment by exchanging a combination of one or two touch passes. Great harmony between the players.
Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) takes the free kick and immediately restarts play with a short pass.
Felix Passlack (Dortmund) was too fierce in his attempt to get the ball from his opponent and Felix Brych blows for a foul. A free kick is awarded to Schalke.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) attempts to find Franco Di Santo with a delicate little through ball from inside the box, but one of the defending players makes a timely intervention.
Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) is adjudged to have been offside when making his run.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Yellow card. Julian Weigl (Dortmund) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) fails to beat the offside trap and the linesman puts his flag up.
Sokratis (Dortmund) makes a rough challenge and the referee blows for a foul.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Ralf Fahrmann (Schalke) tries to take the opposition by surprise with a quick free kick into the box.
Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) manages to beat his opponent to the ball, but he commits a foul in the process. Schalke are given an advantage. They have a free kick.
Felix Brych blows his whistle after Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle.
Ousmane Dembele (Dortmund) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. The ball is out of play. Schalke will have a throw in.
Max Meyer (Schalke) gets to the rebound and shoots, but the effort is blocked.
The linesman raises his flag. Pierre Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is adjudged offside.
The Dortmund players are displaying brilliant short passes and great ball movement. They are waiting to open the opposition's defence and hit them swiftly on the break.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The first half has started.
The players are on the pitch and Dortmund will have the kick off.

annotations.label: lineup1
annotations.description: In the details of this match, you can glance at the lineups while the game is about to begin.
Felix Brych will supervise the game today.
Good afternoon, ladies and gentleman! Welcome to our live text commentary, where we will provide you with instant updates of everything that happens in the match.
Schalke are unbeaten over their past 3 games.
Ousmane Dembele has the most assists (11) for Dortmund this season.
The most prolific goal scorer for Dortmund is Pierre Emerick Aubameyang with 16 goals in this competition so far.

We were witnesses to a rather ordinary game without many stirring moments. There is definitely room for improvement in future games. A very even game was seen on the pitch today. The hosts displayed good teamplay with a lot of passes. The visiting side patiently waited in their own half to dispossess the opponent and hit them on the break.
